alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 28 at 2:17AM EDT until further notice by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 215 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 5.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 AM EDT Wednesday was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested and is expected to slowly fall through Tuesday and then fall below flood stage by later Wednesday night. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.8 feet on 05/12/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.4 Wed 1 am 4.9 4.3 Crested &&
